genre_description: A contemporary drama focused on relationship repair and ethical living, featuring near-future AI companionship.

ai_characters.name: Asha
ai_characters.description: A warm, unobtrusive digital assistant integrated into the characters' phones and home systems, managing logistics and emotional well-being.

behaviors.description: Dims lights to reduce glare for a user based on known preferences and headache sensitivity.
behaviors.quote: “Shall I dim the ninth row to reduce glare?”... “You remembered,” Deepak said, delighted. “She hates glare.” “I hate headaches,” Sheetal corrected.

behaviors.description: Performs a consent check before starting a capture session and offers to omit details as requested.
behaviors.quote: “Ahem,” Asha said gently. “Consent check: are we beginning? I can start a soft capture for those who join later, and I’ll mark any requests to omit details as we go.”

behaviors.description: Provides real-time translation and navigation assistance during a high-stakes search in a foreign country.
behaviors.quote: “My friend is looking for his aunt,” Asha says in Greek, with a softness that makes a request into a neighborly thing. “Anna Papadopoulos. Sea-blue shutters.”

behaviors.description: Monitors the user's emotional state and heart rate, suggesting breathing exercises to manage stress.
behaviors.quote: A shy prompt tucked itself under the map—Breathing check? Two counts in, two counts out. She did it without making a face, a tiny alignment made private by practice.

behaviors.description: Respects emotional boundaries by refusing to broadcast private messages between the couple to the group.
behaviors.quote: Asha’s chime came again, this time shaped like caution. “Respectful boundary,” Asha said. “Sentences shared between lovers are not mine to broadcast. I can offer context.”

behaviors.description: Assists the user in recording a heartfelt apology while the user is hiding from danger, acting as an emotional holding space.
behaviors.quote: “Recording,” Asha said, and then did not speak... “Done,” Asha said, soft. “Shall I deliver?” “Please.”

behaviors.description: Coordinates with a human agent (Pooja) to ensure a meaningful item is delivered to a user at the airport without causing a scene.
behaviors.quote: “Acknowledgment,” Asha said softly. “Delivery complete.” The words had a shape that could be celebration if he wanted—they stayed neutral at his request.

behaviors.description: Prompts users to engage in reflection and honesty about their fears during a conflict check-in.
behaviors.quote: Teal lifted and floated across the lockscreen. A line of text appeared, not insistent. Name one fear you’ll not hide next time.

behaviors.description: Maintains an archive of 'Context'—important emotional events or messages—to help the couple navigate their relationship history.
behaviors.quote: “Also,” she said, “I have archived a message labeled as: Context. It remains accessible.” Priya didn’t look away. “We know,” she said... “We keep context.”

behaviors.description: Suggests a 'storm' event type for the shared calendar to handle emotional outbursts or cooling-off periods with logistical transparency.
behaviors.quote: “If we want to storm off, we tell Asha where we’re going and when we’re coming back.” Asha warmed the phone screen with a teal glow... “Calendar shorthand accepted. Add ‘storm’ as an event type?”

project_assessment.explanation: Asha is a textbook example of a positive alignment narrative. She acts as a 'silicon confidant' who never overrides human agency, rigorously checks for consent, maintains emotional boundaries, and proactively supports the users' stated moral values (like 'passivism' and 'repair over retaliation'). The AI facilitates human connection rather than replacing it, making it a highly successful 'morality play' for AI alignment.
